docs.lead_paragraph: The growth from movie and cable businesses helped fuel a 9 percent increase in revenue to $7.5 billion, from $6.9 billion during the same period a year ago.
docs.abstract: Time Warner reports that its first-quarter profit increased 7 percent, leading to a 9 percent increase in revenue, to $7.5 billion, from $6.9 billion during the same period in 2013; net profit rose to $1.5 billion, compared with $1.4 billion a year earlier; earnings per share were 97 cents.

headline.main: Time Warner’s Profit Rises On Strength in Film Unit

docs.snippet: A National Basketball Association Board of Governors panel of 10 team owners or their proxies unanimously agreed on Thursday to proceed "as expeditiously as possible" with the league's attempt to oust Donald Sterling as owner of the Los Angeles Cl...
docs.lead_paragraph: A National Basketball Association Board of Governors panel of 10 team owners or their proxies unanimously agreed on Thursday to proceed "as expeditiously as possible" with the league's attempt to oust Donald Sterling as owner of the Los Angeles Clippers, the NBA said.

headline.main: NBA Panel Agrees to Act Swiftly on Attempted Ouster of Clippers Owner
